results.title: Atorvastatin does not ameliorate nephrogenic diabetes insipidus induced by lithium or potassium depletion in mice
results.text_hl: The purpose of the current study was to investigate the effect of statins in @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Insipidus_Nephrogenic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018500 @@@Li-NDI@@@. We tested whether @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ could prevent a @CHEMICAL_Lithium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008094 @@@Li@@@-induced @GENE_AQP2 @GENE_11827 @@@AQP2@@@ downregulation in a cortical @DISEASE_Carcinoma_Renal_Cell @DISEASE_MESH:D002292 @@@CD@@@ cell line, and whether @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ have protective effects in @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Insipidus_Nephrogenic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018500 @@@Li-NDI@@@.

citations.NLM: Thomsen ML, Grønkjaer C, Iervolino A, Rej S, Trepiccione F, Christensen BM. Atorvastatin does not ameliorate nephrogenic diabetes insipidus induced by lithium or potassium depletion in mice Physiol Rep. 2021 Nov;9(21):e15111. PMID: 34762363
citations.BibTeX: @article{34762363, title={Atorvastatin does not ameliorate nephrogenic diabetes insipidus induced by lithium or potassium depletion in mice}, author={Thomsen ML and Grønkjaer C and Iervolino A and Rej S and Trepiccione F and Christensen BM}, journal={Physiol Rep}, volume={9}, number={21}, pages={e15111}}

results.title: Effects of sildenafil, metformin, and simvastatin on ADH-independent urine concentration in healthy volunteers
results.text_hl: Although relatively limited in extent, the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ could be beneficial to @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Insipidus_Nephrogenic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018500 @@@NDI@@@ by reducing urine production by approximately 20%.

citations.NLM: Bech AP, Wetzels JFM, Nijenhuis T. Effects of sildenafil, metformin, and simvastatin on ADH-independent urine concentration in healthy volunteers Physiol Rep. 2018 Apr;6(7):e13665. PMID: 29611351
citations.BibTeX: @article{29611351, title={Effects of sildenafil, metformin, and simvastatin on ADH-independent urine concentration in healthy volunteers}, author={Bech AP and Wetzels JFM and Nijenhuis T}, journal={Physiol Rep}, volume={6}, number={7}, pages={e13665}}
